job_title: Anonymous Employee in Port Jefferson, NY
pros: I worked here for 17 years. The patients and staff that have long since retired were what made my day brighter. I left miserable, but with a small pension and 403 B that was a plus.
cons: Not enough cultural diversity. Although while I worked there, I obtained a degree, there was no room for growth. Any position I tried to apply for was conveniently not available, however the person that would eventually get hired was not fit, nor did they last in the position(S). The Nursing staff in my dept wanted to treat me like I was beneath them, then complain because I demanded to be treated as a peer.

job_title: Clerk/Registrar/Intake in Port Jefferson, NY
pros:
- Health benefits for part time workers (albeit expensive as health insurance is)
- Generally work around school schedule if your a student
- New positions open to in house people first
- Cafeteria food for breakfast lunch and dinner is both inexpensive and pretty good
- Good paying jobs even if you don't possess a college degree for non-clinical jobs
- They have a self insured option which is pretty good
- Employees are encouraged to interview those who apply for jobs that they would be working with
cons:
- Some departments are 'cliquish' so if your not in your out
- Supervisors can be rather rude and cliquish themselves
- Always get harped on about productivity with a demand to raise it and make no mistakes, if you do you get berated
- Supervisors will tell you that your abusing your sick time when you take off for being sick or for surgery, example which I've heard many times, employees being out for 6 weeks due to heavy surgery coming in for their review and being told they abused their sick time and need to stop. You can even be told you are abusing your sick time when you've only used 20 hours in the year.
- Insurance companies are always trying to get out of paying which makes insurance jobs and registration jobs difficult (they do try to provide training to keep you up to date)
- Cell phones are not allowed which in of itself is fine, but supervisors will openly use theirs to show off pictures or watch youtube videos then fire you for doing the same thing.
- Many layers of management
- Management tells employees who do peer review that "No one should recieve 5 stars for anything, as that means they have no room for improvement, which is impossible, no one is perfect at anything so the most you can give anyone is 4 stars"

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rocky Point, NY
pros: Great  community hospital,  lots of new ambulatory procedures being done with the new addition to the hospital.  Big hospital status, with the down home feel.
cons: Hard to move up the ladder, they don't really groom people to develop them into roles within the hospital.  There is a lot of capacity for refined effectiveness but no realistic way to approach change without burning bridges.  The down home feel gets a little bit to close to home sometimes.

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Port Jefferson, NY
pros: Friendly community hospital, they have affiliate offices outside of the hospital called Harborview medical services that service the community with primary care, pulmonary care, neurology,  endocrinology,  vascular, cardiology. These affiliate offices are independent from Mather hospital but work cohesive with the hospital for great patient care.
cons: Harborview medical services administration does not create an informative balance with it's employees and Mather hospital. There is a lack of cohesiveness that is felt by the staff in regards to leadership, human resources and general information.

job_title: Nutritional Services Aide in Brookhaven, NY
pros: Very understanding of your personal family medical issues when you need to take off! Decent pay. Many different departments with varying positions & schedules to choose from..
cons: NOT a good place for advancement unless you personally know someone or are related to someone in management. NO medical to retire with only the pension YOU save OR if you can hang in long enough to attain what mather matches, if you can make it to the age they require. This place tends to treat you according to your "position" which is a terrible thing to do to any human being. Management will listen to you with your concerns, advice for improving patient care, or your own gripes, and very rarely will they do anything about it. This is very discouraging and leaves you NO LONGER CARING .

review_title: Rewarding, challenging, frustrating not necessarily in that order.

job_title: Systems Analyst in Port Jefferson, NY

job_title: Food Service Aide in Port Jefferson, NY

Money is good

The case load can be challenging.
